department.dept_long_name: Committee on Concentration in Physical Sciences

course.title: Mechanics, Elasticity, Fluids, and Diffusion
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 9:30-11, and a weekly section and lab to be arranged.
course.description: An introduction to classical mechanics, with special emphasis on the motion of organisms in fluids. Topics covered include: kinematics, Newton's laws of motion, oscillations, elasticity, random walks, diffusion, and fluids. Examples and problem set questions will be drawn from the life sciences and medicine.
course.prerequisites: Physical Sciences 1 (or Chemistry 7), Mathematics 1b, or the equivalent.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Science of the Physical Universe or Empirical and Mathematical Reasoning, but not both.
